name: wid3_F2F2_module10
label: F2F 2: questionnaire on relationships (CASI)
description: This questionnaire module contains questions on: contact and contact frequency to biological parents, twins, siblings not living in the household (anymore); domain-specific satisfaction (health, work/school, income/pocket money, leisure time, family life, partnership, friendships); freetime and cultural activities with family members (self-report); frequency of arguments with partner, frequency of arguments of parents, subjective burden and coping; occurrence and subjective evaluation of important life transitions and developmental tasks (e.g. school enrolment, stays abroad, entering labor market, romantic relationships, change of social environment); parenting style of mother, father, partner of father, partner of mother (child report); partnership and marital status; quality of familial environment (existence of bedtime routine, general atmosphere at home); satisfaction with sibling relationship; self-regulation: consistency of interest, self-control; twin relationship: warmth, conflict, affection, hostility, rivalry; twin-specific questions for parents (e.g., dress twins alike); twin-specific questions for siblings (e.g. relationship of the twins); twin-specific questions for twins themselves (e.g. relationship to other twin).

hoe0100.question: hoe0100
hoe0100.name: hoe0100
hoe0100.label: [ITEMBAT] [IF age <= 21] Please indicate how these statements apply to your home. [IF age> 21 & neuzu == 1] The following statements describe things that occur in many families at home. Please indicate to what extent these statements apply to your home.

items.name: hoe0100
items.text: [ITEMBAT] [IF age <= 21] Please indicate how these statements apply to your home. [IF age> 21 & neuzu == 1] The following statements describe things that occur in many families at home. Please indicate to what extent these statements apply to your home.
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] [IF age >= 10 and <= 15] Bitte gib an, inwiefern diese Aussagen auf Dein Zuhause zutreffen. [IF age >= 16 and <= 21] Bitte geben Sie an, inwiefern diese Aussagen auf Ihr Zuhause zutreffen. [IF age >21 & neuzu==1] Die folgenden Aussagen beschreiben Dinge, die bei vielen Familien zuhause auftreten. Bitte geben Sie an, inwiefern diese Aussagen auf Ihr Zuhause zutreffen.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454
items.description_de: Source: Adaptiert von: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-444

items.name: hoe0100
items.text: [If age> = 10 and <= 13] We have the same bedtime routine every night (e.g. going to bed at the same time every evening, having a bath before going to bed, reading a story, saying our prayers ...).
items.text_de: [If age >= 10 and <=13] Ich habe beim Zubettgehen einen regelmaessigen Ablauf (z.B. jeden Abend dieselbe Schlafenszeit, ein Bad vorm Schlafengehen, eine Geschichte (vor-)lesen, ein Gebet sprechen...).
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454
items.description_de: Source: Adaptiert von: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-444

items.name: hoe0100
items.text: You can't think in peace in our home.
items.text_de: Bei uns zu Hause kann man keinen klaren Gedanken fassen.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454
items.description_de: Source: Adaptiert von: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-444

items.name: hoe0100
items.text: Everything is wild and disorganized in our house.
items.text_de: Bei uns zu Hause geht es drunter und drueber.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454
items.description_de: Source: Adaptiert von: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-444

items.name: hoe0100
items.text: We are usually able to stay on top of things.
items.text_de: Normalerweise haben wir zuhause alles im Griff.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454

items.name: hoe0100
items.text: There is almost always a TV on somewhere in our house
items.text_de: Irgendwo bei uns im Haus laeuft fast immer ein Fernseher.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454
items.description_de: Source: Adaptiert von: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-444

items.name: hoe0100
items.text: The atmosphere in our house is calm and relaxed.
items.text_de: Bei uns zu Hause herrscht eine ruhige Atmosphaere.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454

hoe0101.label: The following statements describe things that occur at home in many families. Please rate how these statements applied to your home when you lived at home.

items.text: The following statements describe things that occur at home in many families. Please rate how these statements applied to your home when you lived at home.
items.text_de: Die folgenden Aussagen beschreiben Dinge, die bei vielen Familien zuhause auftreten. Bitte geben Sie an, inwiefern diese Aussagen auf Ihr Zuhause zutrafen, als Sie noch zuhause gewohnt haben.

items.text: I used to have a regular bedtime routine.

items.text: You couldn't hear yourself think in our home.

items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454

items.name: hoe0101
items.text: It was a real zoo in our home.

items.description: Source: Adapted from: Matheny Jr, A. P., Wachs, T. D., Ludwig, J. L., & Phillips, K. (1995). Bringing order out of chaos: Psychometric characteristics of the confusion, hubbub, and order scale. Journal of Applied Developmental Psychology, 16 (3), 429-454

sre0100.question: sre0100
sre0100.name: sre0100
sre0100.label: [ITEMBAT] [IF fpr0301 = 1] Now we would like to find out a little more about your relationship with your siblings. [IF fpr0301 = 0] Now, we would like to find out a little more about your relationship with your siblings. [IF ptyp = 001] [NCS] How do you get along with <NAME ZWILLING2>? [IF ptyp = 002] [NCS] How do you get along with <NAME ZWILLING1>?

items.name: sre0100
items.text: [ITEMBAT] [IF fpr0301 = 1] Now we would like to find out a little more about your relationship with your siblings. [IF fpr0301 = 0] Now, we would like to find out a little more about your relationship with your siblings. [IF ptyp = 001] [NCS] How do you get along with <NAME ZWILLING2>? [IF ptyp = 002] [NCS] How do you get along with <NAME ZWILLING1>?
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT][IF fpr0301=1] Nun wuerden wir gerne noch etwas mehr ueber die Beziehung zu deinen Geschwistern erfahren. [IF fpr0301=0] Nun wuerden wir gerne noch etwas mehr ueber eure Geschwisterbeziehung erfahren. [IF ptyp = 001] [NCS] Wie ist es bei Dir und <NAME ZWILLING2>? [IF ptyp = 002] [NCS] Wie ist es bei Dir und <NAME ZWILLING1>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Some children do nice things for their siblings, like helping them or doing them favors. How often do you do these kind of things for <name of the twin>?
items.text_de: Manche Kinder tun fuer ihre Geschwister etwas Nettes wie z.B. ihnen zu helfen oder ihnen einen Gefallen zu tun. Wie oft tust Du solche netten Dinge fuer <Name anderer Zwilling>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Most children are sometimes affectionate toward their brother or sister even though they fight at other times. How often are you physically affectionate with <name of twin> (such as hugging, kissing, holding hands)?
items.text_de: [IF sex = 1] Manche Kinder gehen liebevoll mit ihrem Bruder um, auch wenn sie manchmal streiten. Wie oft bist Du liebevoll/zaertlich zu <Name anderer Zwilling>, z.B. indem Du ihn umarmst, kuesst oder seine Hand haeltst? [IF sex = 2] Manche Kinder gehen liebevoll mit ihrer Schwester um, auch wenn sie manchmal streiten. Wie oft bist Du liebevoll/zaertlich zu <Name anderer Zwilling>, z.B. indem Du sie umarmst, kuesst oder ihre Hand haeltst?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: How about if <name of other twin> is hurt or upset, how often do you try to make <name of other twin> feel better?
items.text_de: [IF sex = 1] Wie ist das, wenn <Name anderer Zwilling> sich weh getan hat oder traurig ist, wie oft versuchst Du ihn zu troesten? [IF sex = 2] Wie ist das, wenn <Name anderer Zwilling> sich weh getan hat oder traurig ist, wie oft versuchst Du sie zu troesten?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Some children share secrets with their brothers and sisters and other children don't. How often do you share secrets with <name of other twin>?
items.text_de: Kinder haben manchmal Geheimnisse. Wie oft erzaehlst Du <Name anderer Zwilling> deine Geheimnisse?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Brothers and sisters sometimes cause trouble or start fights or arguments with each other, even if they really love each other. How often would you say that you start fights with or cause trouble for <name of other twin>?
items.text_de: Brueder und Schwestern fangen manchmal einen Streit oder eine Rauferei miteinander an, auch wenn sie sich eigentlich sehr lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft zettelst Du einen Streit an oder bringst <Name anderer Zwilling> in Schwierigkeiten?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: How often do you feel mad or angry at <name of other twin>?
items.text_de: Wie oft bist Du boese oder wuetend auf <Name anderer Zwilling>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Children sometimes hurt their brother or sister on purpose like by pushing, punching, or hitting him or her. How often do you do these kind of things to <name of other twin>?
items.text_de: Kinder tun ihren Geschwistern manchmal absichtlich weh, indem sie sie z.B. schubsen, hauen oder kneifen. Wie oft machst Du so etwas bei <Name anderer Zwilling>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Some children are sometims mean to their brothers or sisters, even if though they really care about them. How often would you say you tease <name of other twin>, wind them up, or call them names?
items.text_de: [IF sex = 1] Manche Kinder sind manchmal gemein zu ihrem Bruder, auch wenn sie ihn wirklich lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft tust Du solche Dinge, wie <Name anderer Zwilling> aergern oder ihn aufzuziehen? [IF sex = 2] Manche Kinder sind manchmal gemein zu ihrer Schwester, auch wenn sie sie wirklich lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft tust Du solche Dinge, wie <Name anderer Zwilling> aergern oder sie aufzuziehen?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Many kids complain that their mothers don't treat them fairly compared to how they treat their brothers and sisters. How is this for you? How often do you feel that your mother treats <name of other twin> better than she treats you?
items.text_de: [IF sex = 1] Manche Kinder beschweren sich darueber, dass ihre Muetter sie und ihren Bruder nicht gleich behandeln. Wie ist das bei Dir? Wie oft hast Du das Gefuehl, dass Deine Mutter <Name anderer Zwilling> besser behandelt als Dich? [IF sex = 2] Manche Kinder beschweren sich darueber, dass ihre Muetter sie und ihre Schwester nicht gleich behandeln. Wie ist das bei Dir? Wie oft hast Du das Gefuehl, dass Deine Mutter <Name anderer Zwilling> besser behandelt als Dich?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: How about your father? How often do you feel that he treats <name of other twin> better than he treats you?
items.text_de: Wie ist es mit Deinem Vater? Wie oft hast Du das Gefuehl, dass er <Name anderer Zwilling> besser behandelt als Dich?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100
items.text: Some children sometimes feel jealous or upset about the attention or affection their mother gives their brother or sister. How often do you feel kind of jealous about how your mother treats <name of other twin>?
items.text_de: Wie ist es mit Deiner Mutter? Wie oft fuehlst Du so etwas wie Eifersucht, wenn Deine Mutter <Name anderer Zwilling> Aufmerksamkeit oder Zuneigung schenkt?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.text: How about your father? How often do you feel kind of jealous about your father's attention or affection toward <name of other twin>?
items.text_de: Wie ist es mit Deinem Vater? Wie oft fuehlst Du so etwas wie Eifersucht, wenn Dein Vater <Name anderer Zwilling> Aufmerksamkeit oder Zuneigung schenkt?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

sre0100s.name: sre0100s
sre0100s.label: What about with you and [name of sibling]?

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: What about with you and [name of sibling]?
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] [NCS] Wie ist es bei Dir und <NAME_GESCHWISTER?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: What about doing nice things like helping or doing favors for [name of sibling]? How often do you do these kind of things?
items.text_de: Manche Kinder tun fuer ihre Geschwister etwas Nettes wie z.B. ihnen zu helfen oder ihnen einen Gefallen zu tun. Wie oft tust so solche netten Dinge fuer <NAME GESCHWISTER>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: Most children are affectionate with their brother or sister sometimes even though they fight at other times. How often are you physically affectionate with [name of sibling] (such as by hugging, kissing, holding hands)?
items.text_de: [If sex_geschwister =1] Manche Kinder gehen liebevoll mit ihrem Bruder um, auch wenn sie manchmal streiten. Wie oft bist Du liebevoll/zaertlich zu <NAME GESCHWISTER>, z.B. indem Du ihn umarmst, kuesst oder seine Hand haeltst? [If sex_geschwister =2] Manche Kinder gehen liebevoll mit ihrer Schwester um, auch wenn sie manchmal streiten. Wie oft bist Du liebevoll/zaertlich zu <NAME GESCHWISTER>, z.B. indem Du sie umarmst, kuesst oder ihre Hand haeltst?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: How about if [name of sibling] is hurt or upset, how often do you try to make [target sibling] feel better?
items.text_de: [If sex_geschwister =2] Wie ist das, wenn <NAME GESCHWISTER> sich weh getan hat oder traurig ist, wie oft versuchst Du sie zu troesten? [If sex_geschwister =1] Wie ist das, wenn <NAME GESCHWISTER> sich weh getan hat oder traurig ist, wie oft versuchst Du ihn zu troesten?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: Some children share secrets with their brothers and sisters and other children don't. How often do you share secrets with [name of sibling]?
items.text_de: Kinder haben manchmal Geheimnisse. Wie oft erzaehlst Du <NAME GESCHWISTER> deine Geheimnisse?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: Brothers and sisters sometimes cause trouble or start fights or arguments with one another, even if they love each other a lot. How often would you say that you start fights or cause trouble for [name of sibling]?
items.text_de: Brueder und Schwestern fangen manchmal einen Streit oder eine Rauferei miteinander an, auch wenn sie sich eigentlich sehr lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft zettelst Du einen Streit an oder bringst <NAME GESCHWISTER> in Schwierigkeiten?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: How often do you feel mad or angry at [name of sibling]?
items.text_de: Wie oft bist Du boese oder wuetend auf <NAME GESCHWISTER>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: Children sometimes hurt their brother or sister on purpose like by pushing, punching or hitting him or her. How often do you do these kind of things to [name of sibling]?
items.text_de: Kinder tun ihren Geschwistern manchmal absichtlich weh, indem sie sie z.B. schubsen, hauen oder kneifen. Wie oft machst Du so etwas bei <NAME GESCHWISTER>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100s
items.text: Some children are mean to their brothers or sisters sometimes, even if they really care about them. How often would you say you do things to [name of sibling] like tease, bug or call him or her names?
items.text_de: [If sex_geschwister =1] Manche Kinder sind manchmal gemein zu ihrem Bruder, auch wenn sie ihn wirklich lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft tust Du solche Dinge, wie <NAME GESCHWISTER> aergern oder ihn aufzuziehen? [If sex_geschwister =2] Manche Kinder sind manchmal gemein zu ihrer Schwester, auch wenn sie sie wirklich lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft tust Du solche Dinge, wie <NAME GESCHWISTER> aergern oder sie aufzuziehen?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.text_de: [If sex_Zwilling =1] Manche Kinder beschweren sich darueber, dass ihre Muetter sie und ihren Bruder nicht gleich behandeln .Wie ist das bei Dir? Wie oft hast Du das Gefuehl, dass Deine Mutter <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> besser behandelt als Dich? [If sex_ Zwilling =2] Manche Kinder beschweren sich darueber, dass ihre Muetter sie und ihre Schwester nicht gleich behandeln Wie ist das bei Dir? Wie oft hast Du das Gefuehl, dass Deine Mutter <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> besser behandelt als Dich?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100t
items.text: How about with your father? How often do you feel that he treats [name of twin 1] better than he treats you?
items.text_de: Wie ist es mit Deinem Vater? Wie oft hast Du das Gefuehl, dass er <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> besser behandelt als Dich?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100t
items.text: How about with your mother? How often do you feel sort of jealous about your mother's attention or affection toward [name of twin 1]?
items.text_de: Wie ist es mit Deiner Mutter? Wie oft fuehlst Du so etwas wie Eifersucht, wenn Deine Mutter<NAME DES ZWILLINGS> Aufmerksamkeit oder Zuneigung schenkt?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.text_de: Wie ist es mit Deinem Vater? Wie oft fuehlst Du so etwas wie Eifersucht, wenn Dein Vater<NAME DES ZWILLINGS> Aufmerksamkeit oder Zuneigung schenkt?

sre0100u.question: sre0100u
sre0100u.name: sre0100u
sre0100u.label: What about with you and [name of twin 2]?

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: What about with you and [name of twin 2]?
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] [If Nun wuerden wir gerne noch etwas mehr ueber die Beziehung zu deinen Geschwistern erfahren. [NCS]Wie ist es bei Dir und <NAME DES ZWILLINGS>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: What about doing nice things like helping or doing favors for [name of twin 2]? How often do you do these kind of things?
items.text_de: Manche Kinder tun fuer ihre Geschwister etwas Nettes wie z.B. ihnen zu helfen oder ihnen einen Gefallen zu tun. Wie oft tust so solche netten Dinge fuer <NAME DES ZWILLINGS>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: Most children are affectionate with their brother or sister sometimes even though they fight at other times. How often are you physically affectionate with [name of twin 2] (such as by hugging, kissing, holding hands)?
items.text_de: [If sex_Zwilling =1] Manche Kinder gehen liebevoll mit ihrem Bruder um, auch wenn sie manchmal streiten. Wie oft bist Du liebevoll/zaertlich zu <NAME DES ZWILLINGS>, z.B. indem Du ihn umarmst, kuesst oder seine Hand haeltst? [If sex_Zwilling =2] Manche Kinder gehen liebevoll mit ihrer Schwester um, auch wenn sie manchmal streiten. Wie oft bist Du liebevoll/zaertlich zu <NAME DES ZWILLINGS>, z.B. indem Du sie umarmst, kuesst oder ihre Hand haeltst?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: How about if [name of twin 2] is hurt or upset, how often do you try to make [twin 2] feel better?
items.text_de: [If sex_Zwilling =2] Wie ist das, wenn <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> sich weh getan hat oder traurig ist, wie oft versuchst Du sie zu troesten? [If sex_Zwilling =1] Wie ist das, wenn <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> sich weh getan hat oder traurig ist, wie oft versuchst Du ihn zu troesten?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: Some children share secrets with their brothers and sisters and other children don't. How often do you share secrets with [name of twin 2]?
items.text_de: Kinder haben manchmal Geheimnisse. Wie oft erzaehlst Du <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> deine Geheimnisse?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: Brothers and sisters sometimes cause trouble or start fights or arguments with one another, even if they love each other a lot. How often would you say that you start fights or cause trouble for [name of twin 2]?
items.text_de: Brueder und Schwestern fangen manchmal einen Streit oder eine Rauferei miteinander an, auch wenn sie sich eigentlich sehr lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft zettelst Du einen Streit an oder bringst <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> in Schwierigkeiten?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: How often do you feel mad or angry at [name of twin 2]?
items.text_de: Wie oft bist Du boese oder wuetend auf <NAME DES ZWILLINGS>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: Children sometimes hurt their brother or sister on purpose like by pushing, punching or hitting him or her. How often do you do these kind of things to [name of twin 2]?
items.text_de: Kinder tun ihren Geschwistern manchmal absichtlich weh, indem sie sie z.B. schubsen, hauen oder kneifen. Wie oft machst Du so etwas bei <NAME DES ZWILLINGS>?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859
items.description_de: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

items.name: sre0100u
items.text: Some children are mean to their brothers or sisters sometimes, even if they really care about them. How often would you say you do things to [name of twin 2] like tease, bug or call him or her names?
items.text_de: [If sex_Zwilling =1] Manche Kinder sind manchmal gemein zu ihrem Bruder, auch wenn sie ihn wirklich lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft tust Du solche Dinge, wie <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> aergern oder ihn aufzuziehen? [If sex_Zwilling =2] Manche Kinder sind manchmal gemein zu ihrer Schwester, auch wenn sie sie wirklich lieb haben. Was wuerdest Du sagen, wie oft tust Du solche Dinge, wie <NAME DES ZWILLINGS> aergern oder sie aufzuziehen?
items.description: Source: Boer, F., Westenberg, P. M., McHale, S. M., Updegraff, K. A., & Stocker, C. M. (1997). The factorial structure of the Sibling Relationship Inventory (SRI) in American and Dutch samples. Journal of Social and Personal Relationships, 14(6), 851-859

sre0200.question: sre0200
sre0200.name: sre0200
sre0200.label: [IF sex = 1] Now some more questions about your relationship with your twin brother: What's it like with you and [name of other twin]? [IF sex = 2] Now some more questions about your relationship with your twin sister: What's it like with you and [name of other twin]?

items.name: sre0200
items.text: [IF sex = 1] Now some more questions about your relationship with your twin brother: What's it like with you and [name of other twin]? [IF sex = 2] Now some more questions about your relationship with your twin sister: What's it like with you and [name of other twin]?
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] [IF age = 15 and sex = 1] Nun kommen einige weitere Fragen zu Deiner Beziehung zu Deinem Bruder: [NCS] Wie ist es bei Dir und <Name anderer Zwilling>? [IF age = 15 and sex = 2] Nun kommen einige weitere Fragen zu Deiner Beziehung zu Deiner Schwester: [NCS] Wie ist es bei Dir und <Name anderer Zwilling>? [IF age >= 16 and sex = 1] Nun kommen einige weitere Fragen zu Ihrer Beziehung zu Ihrem Bruder: [NCS] Wie ist es bei Dir und <Name anderer Zwilling>? [IF age >= 16 and sex = 2] Nun kommen einige weitere Fragen zu Ihrer Beziehung zu Ihrer Schwester: [NCS] Wie ist es bei Dir und <Name anderer Zwilling>?
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Stocker, C. M., Lanthier, R. P., & Furman, W. (1997). Sibling relationships in Early Adulthood. Journal of Family Psychology, 11 (2), 210-221; Heyeres, U. (2006). Adult sibling relationship questionnaire. Gruppendynamik und Organisationsberatung, 37 (2), 215-225.
items.description_de: Source: Adaptiert von: Stocker, C. M., Lanthier, R. P., & Furman, W. (1997). Sibling relationships in Early Adulthood. Journal of Family Psychology, 11 (2), 210-221; Heyeres, U. items.name: sre0200
items.text: How often do you speak with [name] about things that are important to you?
items.text_de: [IF age >= 16] Wie oft sprechen Sie mit [Name des anderen Zwillings] ueber Dinge, die Ihnen wichtig sind? [IF age == 15] Wie oft sprichst Du mit [Name des anderen Zwillings] ueber Dinge, die Dir wichtig sind?

con0303s.label: When did <name child> see the biological mother the last time? Please report month (e.g. 01 for january) and year (e.g. 2010).

items.name: con0303s
items.text: When did <name child> see the biological mother the last time? Please report month (e.g. 01 for january) and year (e.g. 2010).
items.text_de: Wann hat <NAME DES KINDES> die leibliche Mutter das letzte Mal gesehen? Bitte geben Sie Monat (z.B. 01 fuer Januar) und Jahr (z.B. 2010) an.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Panel analysis of intimate relationships and family dynamics (pairfam): Pairfam Codebook Child Wave 3 2010/11

con0304t.question: con0304t
con0304t.name: con0304t
con0304t.label: How often has <name child> been in contact with <name biological mother> in the past 6 months or since moving out, for example by phone, mail, etc.?

items.name: con0304t
items.text: How often has <name child> been in contact with <name biological mother> in the past 6 months or since moving out, for example by phone, mail, etc.?
items.text_de: Wie haeufig hat <NAME DES KINDES> in den letzten 6 Monaten (bzw. seit Auszug, wenn dieser kuerzer zurueckliegt) mit der leiblichen Mutter sonstigen Kontakt gehabt, z.B. per Telefon, Email etc.? Persoenliche Treffen sind hiermit nicht gemeint.
items.description: Source: Adapted from: Panel analysis of intimate relationships and family dynamics (pairfam): Pairfam Codebook Child Wave 3 2010/11
items.description_de: Source: Adaptiert von: Beziehungs- und Familienpanel (pairfam): Pairfam Codebuch Kind Welle 3 2010/11

answers.label: 2: once or several times in the last six month
answers.label_de: 2: ein oder mehrmals im halben Jahr

pas0100m.question: pas0100m
pas0100m.name: pas0100m
pas0100m.label: How often do the following things typically happen between you and your mother <name mother>?

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: How often do the following things typically happen between you and your mother <name mother>?
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] Im Folgenden geht es um Deine Beziehung zu Deiner Familie. Wir beginnen mit Fragen zu Deiner Mutter. Es gibt hier keine richtigen oder falschen Antworten, gib uns bitte einfach Deine persoenliche Meinung. Wenn Du Dir nicht sicher bist, antworte mit der Option, die Deiner Meinung nach am besten zutrifft. [NCS] Wie haeufig kommen folgende Dinge typischerweise zwischen Dir und Deiner Mutter <NAME DER MUTTER> vor?
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother shows you that she likes you.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter zeigt dir, dass sie dich gerne hat.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother praises you.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter lobt dich.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother tries to cheer you up when you are sad.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter troestet dich, wenn du traurig bist.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother gives you advice regarding your personal problems.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter unterstuetzt dich, wenn du ein Problem hast.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother punishes you when you do something against her will.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter bestraft dich, wenn du etwas gegen ihren Willen tust.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother is disappointed and sad because you misbehaved.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter ist enttaeuscht und traurig, wenn du dich schlecht benommen hast.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother makes it clear to you that you are not to break the rules or question her decisions.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter gibt dir zu verstehen, dass du dich ihren Anordnungen nicht widersetzen sollst.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother yells at you because you did something wrong.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter schreit dich an, wenn du etwas falsch gemacht hast.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother scolds you because she is angry at you.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter beschimpft dich, wenn sie wuetend auf dich ist.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: When you make new friends, your mother talks to you about them.
items.text_de: Wenn du neue Freunde hast, unterhaelt sich Deine Mutter mit dir ueber diese Freunde.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: When you make new friends, your mother gets to know them soon thereafter.
items.text_de: Wenn du neue Freunde hast, lernt Deine Mutter diese auch bald kennen.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother threatens you with a punishment but does not actually follows through.
items.text_de: Deine Mutter droht dir eine Strafe an, straft dich dann aber doch nicht.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100m
items.text: Your mother finds it hard to set and keep consistent rules for you.
items.text_de: Deiner Mutter faellt es schwer, in ihrer Erziehung konsequent zu sein (z.B. auf die Einhaltung von vereinbarten Regeln oder Verbote zu achten).
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

pas0100f.question: pas0100f
pas0100f.name: pas0100f
pas0100f.label: How often do the following things typically happen between you and your father [name of father]?

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: How often do the following things typically happen between you and your father [name of father]?
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] Nun folgen einige Fragen zu Deinem Vater. Auch hier gibt es keine richtigen oder falschen Antworten, sag uns bitte einfach Deine persoenliche Meinung. Wenn Du dir nicht sicher bist, gib die Option an, die Deiner Meinung nach am besten zutrifft. [NCS] Wie haeufig kommen folgende Dinge typischerweise zwischen Dir und Deinem Vater <NAME DES VATERS> vor?
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father shows you that he likes you.
items.text_de: Dein Vater zeigt dir, dass er dich gerne hat.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father praises you.
items.text_de: Dein Vater lobt dich.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father tries to cheer you up when you are sad.
items.text_de: Dein Vater troestet dich, wenn du traurig bist.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father gives you advice regarding your personal problems.
items.text_de: Dein Vater unterstuetzt dich, wenn du ein Problem hast.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father punishes you when you do something against his will.
items.text_de: Dein Vater bestraft dich, wenn du etwas gegen seinen Willen tust.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father is disappointed and sad because you misbehaved.
items.text_de: Dein Vater ist enttaeuscht und traurig, wenn du dich schlecht benommen hast.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father makes it clear to you that you are not to break the rules or question his decisions.
items.text_de: Dein Vater gibt dir zu verstehen, dass du dich seinen Anordnungen nicht widersetzen sollst.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father yells at you because you did something wrong.
items.text_de: Dein Vater schreit dich an, wenn du etwas falsch gemacht hast.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father scolds you because he is angry at you.
items.text_de: Dein Vater beschimpft dich, wenn er wuetend auf dich ist.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: When you make new friends, your father talks to you about them.
items.text_de: Wenn du neue Freunde hast, unterhaelt sich Dein Vater mit dir ueber diese Freunde.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: When you make new friends, your father gets to know them soon thereafter.
items.text_de: Wenn du neue Freunde hast, lernt Dein Vater diese auch bald kennen.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father threatens you with a punishment but does not actually follows through.
items.text_de: Dein Vater droht dir eine Strafe an, straft dich dann aber doch nicht.
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

items.name: pas0100f
items.text: Your father finds it hard to set and keep consistent rules for you.
items.text_de: Deinem Vater faellt es schwer, in seiner Erziehung konsequent zu sein (z.B. auf die Einhaltung von vereinbarten Regeln oder Verbote zu achten).
items.description: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3
items.description_de: Source: Schmahl, F., Wilhelm, B., Friedrich, S., Wendt, E.-V., Thoennissen, C., & Walper, S. (2012). Scales Manual of the German Family Panel. Wave 1 to 3

pas0100g.question: pas0100g

pas0100g.label: How often do the following things typically happen between you and your stepfather [name of stepfather]?

items.name: pas0100g
items.text: How often do the following things typically happen between you and your stepfather [name of stepfather]?
items.text_de: Nun moechte ich Dir noch ein paar Fragen zu <NAME STIEFVATER> stellen.Sag uns bitte wieder einfach Deine persoenliche Meinung. bus0100.question: bus0100
bus0100.name: bus0100
bus0100.label: In many relationships, partners fight at least occasionally. How about you? [IF fam0300 = 1 or (sex = 1 and fam0100 = 3) or (sex = 2 and fam0100 = 1) or (partner = 1 and sex_zwilling = 1)] How often do you argue with your partner?[IF fam0300 = 2 or (sex = 2 and fam0100 = 3) or (sex = 1 and fam0100 = 1) or (Partner = 1 and sex_zwilling = 2)] How often do you argue with your partner?

items.name: bus0100
items.text: In many relationships, partners fight at least occasionally. How about you? [IF fam0300 = 1 or (sex = 1 and fam0100 = 3) or (sex = 2 and fam0100 = 1) or (partner = 1 and sex_zwilling = 1)] How often do you argue with your partner?[IF fam0300 = 2 or (sex = 2 and fam0100 = 3) or (sex = 1 and fam0100 = 1) or (Partner = 1 and sex_zwilling = 2)] How often do you argue with your partner?
items.text_de: In vielen Partnerschaften kommt es zumindest gelegentlich zu Streit. Wie ist es bei Ihnen? [IF fam0300 = 1 or (sex=1 and fam0100=3) or (sex=2 and fam0100=1) or (Partner= 1 and sex_zwilling = 1)] Wie oft streiten Sie sich mit Ihrem Partner? [IF fam0300 = 2 or (sex=2 and fam0100=3) or (sex=1 and fam0100=1) or (Partner= 1 and sex_zwilling = 2)] Wie oft streiten Sie sich mit Ihrer Partnerin?
items.description: Source: Developed for the project children from addiction-affected families - risk and resilience factors (Contact E.Hahn for detailed information); Adapted from: Grych, J. H., Seid, M., & Fincham, F. D. (1992). Assessing marital conflict from the child's perspective: The Children's Perception of Interparental Conflict Scale. Child development, 63(3), 558-572.
items.description_de: Source: Entwickelt fuer das Projekt Kinder aus suchtbelasteten Famlien - Risiko- und Resilienzfaktoren (Kontaktieren Sie E.Hahn fuer detailierte Informationen); Adaptiert von:  Grych, J. H., Seid, M., & Fincham, F. D. (1992). Assessing marital conflict from the child's perspective: The Children's Perception of Interparental Conflict Scale. Child development, 63(3), 558-572.

answers.label: 1: less often or not at all

bus0101.question: bus0101
bus0101.name: bus0101
bus0101.label: Overall, how stressful do you find fighting with your partner? Please answer using the following scale. 0 means: not stressful at all. 10 means: very stressful. With the values ââbetween 0 and 10 you can graduate your opinion.

items.name: bus0101
items.text: Overall, how stressful do you find fighting with your partner? Please answer using the following scale. 0 means: not stressful at all. 10 means: very stressful. With the values ââbetween 0 and 10 you can graduate your opinion.
items.text_de: [IF fam0300 = 1 or (sex=1 and fam0100=3) or (sex=2 and fam0100=1) or (Partner= 1 and sex_zwilling = 1)] Alles in allem, wie belastet sind Sie durch den Streit mit Ihrem Partner? Antworten Sie bitte anhand der folgenden Skala. Der Wert 0 bedeutet: ueberhaupt nicht belastet. Der Wert 10 bedeutet: sehr belastet. Mit den Werten zwischen 0 und 10 koennen Sie Ihre Meinung abstufen. [IF fam0300 = 2 or (sex=2 and fam0100=3) or (sex=1 and fam0100=1)or (Partner= 1 and sex_zwilling = 2)]Alles in allem, wie belastet sind Sie durch den Streit mit Ihrer Partnerin? Mit den Werten zwischen 0 und 10 koennen Sie Ihre Meinung abstufen.

items.text_de: [IF fam0300 = 1 or (sex=1 and fam0100=3) or (sex=2 and fam0100=1)] Alles in allem, wie belastet ist <NAME DES KINDES> durch den Streit zwischen Ihnen und Ihrem Partner? Antworten Sie bitte anhand der folgenden Skala. Der Wert 0 bedeutet: ueberhaupt nicht belastet. Der Wert 10 bedeutet: sehr belastet. Mit den Werten zwischen 0 und 10 koennen Sie Ihre Meinung abstufen. [IF fam0300 = 2 or (sex=2 and fam0100=3) or (sex=1 and fam0100=1)] Alles in allem, wie belastet ist <NAME DES KINDES> durch den Streit zwischen Ihnen und Ihrer Partnerin? Antworten Sie bitte anhand der folgenden Skala. Der Wert 0 bedeutet: ueberhaupt nicht belastet. Der Wert 10 bedeutet: sehr belastet. Mit den Werten zwischen 0 und 10 koennen Sie Ihre Meinung abstufen.

srg0100.question: srg0100
srg0100.name: srg0100
srg0100.label: Let's turn to some statements that may apply to you more or less . Please provide us with each statement on how you personally assess in comparison with other people . There are no right or wrong answers , you simply respond spontaneously . You can your answer on a scale from 1 'does not apply to me ' to 5 'applies to me' grade . How much do the following statements apply to you?

items.name: srg0100
items.text: Let's turn to some statements that may apply to you more or less . Please provide us with each statement on how you personally assess in comparison with other people . There are no right or wrong answers , you simply respond spontaneously . You can your answer on a scale from 1 'does not apply to me ' to 5 'applies to me' grade . How much do the following statements apply to you?
items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] [IF age >=16 Jahre] Geben Sie uns bitte bei jeder der folgenden Aussagen an, wie Sie sich persoenlich im Vergleich zu anderen Menschen einschaetzen. Es gibt dabei keine richtigen und falschen Antworten, antworten Sie einfach spontan. [NCS]Wie sehr treffen die folgenden Aussagen auf Sie zu? [IF age >=10 und <=15 Jahre] Bitte gib fuer jede der folgenden Aussagen an, wie Du Dich im Vergleich zu anderen Menschen einschaetzt. Es gibt dabei keine richtigen und falschen Antworten, antworte einfach spontan. [NCS] Wie sehr treffen die folgenden Aussagen auf Dich zu?
items.description: Source: Fleckenstein, J., Schmidt, F. T. C., & Moeller, J. (2014). Wer hat Biss? Beharrlichkeit und bestaendiges Interesse von Lehramtsstudierenden. Eine deutsche Adaptation der 12-Item Grit Scale. Psychologie in Erziehung und Unterricht, 61, 281-286
items.description_de: Source: Fleckenstein, J., Schmidt, F. T. C., & Moeller, J. (2014). Wer hat Biss? Beharrlichkeit und bestaendiges Interesse von Lehramtsstudierenden. Eine deutsche Adaptation der 12-Item Grit Scale. Psychologie in Erziehung und Unterricht, 61, 281-286

items.name: bus0500

items.text_de: [ITEMBAT] Manchmal bekommen Kinder mit, wenn sich ihre Eltern streiten. Wie reagierst du in solchen Situationen? Bitte gib an, wie sehr du den folgenden Aussagen zustimmst. Du kannst deine Antwort auf einer Skala von -2 Stimmt nicht bis +2 Stimmt abstufen. [NCS] Wenn meine Eltern streiten...
